Articles.Content:
So, i started using another internet provider, they said their internet was really fast, i was going to test it by downloading a game from steam.

They weren't kidding.

Spanish translations:

Velocidad actual: Current Speed

Pico: Peak
Two gigabytes per second? I am skeptical. How would you even get that into your PC? Gigabit ethernet wouldn't cut it, tops out at 100MB/s or so.
It might be gigabits per second...
Even two gigabits would be beyond the capacity of consumer networking gear.
Did you download the internet?
Those are 2 billion gigabytes per second.
Herpy derp, I totally missed that. Congrats on being the new king of the interweb.

Herpy derp, I totally missed that. Congrats on being the new king of the interweb.

Changed my user title.

Two gigabytes per second? I am skeptical. How would you even get that into your PC? Gigabit ethernet wouldn't cut it, tops out at 100MB/s or so.

My nighthawk router is capable of 1300Mbps at 5ghz bandwidth.

B-b-b-bu..b-b-b-b-but HOW!? *Goes off to cower in corner*

(1 mBp/s on very good days isn't the best, but hey, at least I don't have to measure it in baud!)
wait.....i'm confused
Offtopic, how do you say velocity in Spanish if velocidad is speed?

Offtopic, how do you say velocity in Spanish if velocidad is speed?

Velocity: Velocidad

Speed: Rapidez or Velocidad

care to lend me some bandwidth?

mine's been going steadily downhill since Virgin media bought out NTL
It's a bug with steam, it happens to me every now and again.

It isnt THAT fast.

It just is a glitch in Steam.

I have encountered it more than 10 times.

But have your fun!

Even two gigabits would be beyond the capacity of consumer networking gear.

I have two gigabits. I downloaded a two gigabyte game in one minute.

I have two gigabits. I downloaded a two gigabyte game in one minute.

That's about 35 megabytes/second, or about 350 megabits/second.

This happened to me before. Steam karked it in when I was downloading something, and said my peak was around what this one is. But the thing is, by internet is bandwidth limited to 196KB/s. that Kilobytes. per second. Horrible, I know.

It's a bug with steam, it happens to me every now and again.
It isnt THAT fast.

It just is a glitch in Steam.

I have encountered it more than 10 times.

But have your fun!

Ah. Thank you. I was severely confused.

This happened to me before. Steam karked it in when I was downloading something, and said my peak was around what this one is. But the thing is, by internet is bandwidth limited to 196KB/s. that Kilobytes. per second. Horrible, I know.

Mine internet has kicked up to 2.4 Mb/s before. When tested with ookla it usually sits aroudn 1.3 or 1.4. It's decent. The fastest internet i've ever had that's for sure. But usually it hangs down around 400-500 Kb/s

My home internet was crap and hardly ever got above 200 kBps or so. Then I moved to college, and I'm getting ethernet downloads speeds of around 3-4 MBps. Downloaded Portal 2 in under half an hour (as opposed to the 19 hours it took back home).

My home internet was crap and hardly ever got above 200 kBps or so. Then I moved to college, and I'm getting ethernet downloads speeds of around 3-4 MBps. Downloaded Portal 2 in under half an hour (as opposed to the 19 hours it took back home).

wow, that is impressive. the xbox 360 port of portal 2 takes 14+ hours easily to download through my crappy internet.
